result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Samuel Matthew Laverack was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order regarding IID

Attorney Rebecca M Coffee in court.   Defendant Samuel Matthew Laverack did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance if waived for today. Attorney Coffee is requesting that the IID be waived for the defendant until he can get a valid driver's license. State has no objections. Court grants the request. Defendant may be exempt from having the IID until he can get his valid driver's license.
Filed by Attorney Coffee requesting exemption from installation of IID until defendant obtains a valid driver's license.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Samuel Matthew Laverack in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended complaint.  Defendant pleads guilty to the amended count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Amended Count #2 is dismissed of operations of law.  Count #3 is dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Coffee makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of 

8 months Huber concurrent to 15CT213, may be transferred to Racine Countywith STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
No contact with with any premise thats primary use is to sell alcohol

Condition Time: 45 days consecutive to 15CT213 Huber may be transferred to Raince County - To commence forthwith. 
FINE:  $1683.00, bail to be applied from this case, and the reaminder of the bail in 15CM295 to be applied.  The remainder of the fee due to be paid as a condition of probation

DL REVOCATION:  30 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 30 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel
